title: 1976년 Ivan C. Thompson v. United States of America, Gregory T. Givens v. United States 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Ivan C. Thompson v. United States of America, Gregory T. Givens v. United States. 판결일: 1976-11-24. 법원: Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Ivan C. THOMPSON, Petitioner, v. UNITED STATES of America, Respondent; Gregory T. GIVENS, Petitioner, v. UNITED STATES of America, Respondent
**판결일**: 1976-11-24
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: III, Robinson, Spottswood, Tamm

## 변호인

Michael L. Rankin, Washington, D. C., was on the pleading for petitioner in No. 75-8086., Paul G. Evans, Baltimore, Md., was on the pleading for petitioner in No. 76-8014.

## 인용

- 548 F.2d 1031
- 179 U.S. App. D.C. 76

## 판결문 요약

548 F.2d 1031
    179 U.S.App.D.C. 76
    Ivan C. THOMPSON, Petitioner,v.UNITED STATES of America, Respondent.Gregory T. GIVENS, Petitioner,v.UNITED STATES of America, Respondent.
    Nos. 75-8086 and 76-8014.
    United States Court of Appeals,District of Columbia Circuit.
    Nov. 24, 1976.
    
      Michael L. Rankin, Washington, D. C., was on the pleading for petitioner in No. 75-8086.
      Paul G. Evans, Baltimore, Md., was on the pleading for petitioner in No. 76-8014.
      Before TAMM and ROBINSON, Circuit Judges.
      Opinion for the Court filed by SPOTTSWOOD W. ROBINSON, III, Circuit Judge.
      SPOTTSWOOD W. ROBINSON, III, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      The Superior Court of the District of Columbia has original jurisdiction over "any criminal case under any law applicable exclusively to the District of Columbia."1 Petitioners Thompson and Givens were each charged in unrelated proceedings in the Superior Court with assaulting a District of Columbia police officer, in violation of D.C.Code § 22-505(a).2 Each has consistently claimed that since § 22-505(a) might have extraterritorial effect3 it is not "applicable exclusively to the District of Columbia," and hence violations of that section were not cognizable in the Superior Court.  The District of Columbia Court of Appeals disagreed,4 and Thompson and Givens now petition this court for allowance of an appeal from the Court of Appeal's determination that the Superior Court had power to act in t...
